headline: Welcome to Moving Meditation
main-text:
A lively workshop series for anyone seeking a conscious pause and a way to rediscover the moment.

The practice
Through “moving meditation” joyful techniques that bring balance and cultivate playful lightness when practiced regularly are shared. Each session invites you to explore alternative forms of mindfulness — dynamic, curious, and experimental — that reconnect body and mind.

What to expect
A colorful mix of moving meditations, activating and relaxing sequences, inspired by tantric, Sufism, and occupational therapy impulses — playful, profound, and holistic. Together we create a safe space to experiment, express, and simply be.

Participation
To keep it personal and mindful, groups are limited to 7-10 participants.
Note: Wear comfortable clothes that allow free movement — no sportswear required.

Let's move. Let's pause. Let's meditate.
teacher-bio:
Movement and awareness are at the heart of my practice.
I see the body as a gateway to the inner world, guiding diverse forms of expression toward balance and presence.
Raised in Berlin, I've spent years exploring the body-mind connection through studies, travel, and practice across India, South & Middle America, North Africa, and Europe. I've practiced Hatha, Ashtanga, and Vinyasa yoga for over 15 years, and continue to explore Vipassana and other ancient meditation techniques. My mantra: It is simple.

Contact me if you wish to experience a mind-blowing, all-inclusive retreat in the Moroccan desert, Sicilian landscapes, or Greece (max. 8 people).

I look forward to seeing you!


Sessions

Private Online Sessions are available.

When the body moves, the mind becomes still - and awareness arises.
